title: Initial VitaSense app (AI health future-ready)

requirements.text: Create the initial VitaSense frontend with a public landing page that explains the product (future AI health-related app), includes a clear call-to-action to sign in, and shows a brief disclaimer that the app is not medical advice.

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the app shows a landing page branded as “VitaSense”.
Landing page includes a short description of the app’s goal (future AI health related).
Landing page includes an explicit non-medical disclaimer in English.
Landing page includes a sign-in entry point (button/link) even if the user is not signed in.

requirements.text: Add Internet Identity sign-in to the VitaSense app and display signed-in state (principal) in the UI, with sign-out support.

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: User can sign in using Internet Identity.
After sign-in, the UI displays that the user is signed in (e.g., principal).
User can sign out and returns to signed-out state.

requirements.text: Implement a basic backend user profile model keyed by the caller principal, with endpoints to create/read/update a profile (name, age range, health goals text, createdAt/updatedAt timestamps).

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores one profile per principal and persists across refreshes.
There are backend methods to get the current caller’s profile and upsert it.
Timestamps are set/updated appropriately when profile is created/updated.

requirements.text: Create a signed-in dashboard UI that lets the user view and edit their VitaSense profile (name, age range, health goals) and saves it via the backend.

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: Signed-in users can open a dashboard page/section.
Dashboard shows profile fields and allows editing.
Saving updates persists and reloads correctly (confirmed by refresh).
Errors from backend are surfaced to the user in English.

requirements.text: Add a simple health log feature (MVP) that allows a signed-in user to create and view time-stamped entries for a small set of daily metrics (e.g., mood 1–5, sleep hours, notes). Store per-user entries in the backend and display them in the dashboard.

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: User can add a new health log entry with mood, sleep hours, and notes.
Entries are stored per principal and persist across refreshes.
Dashboard displays a list of entries sorted newest-first.
User can view at least the last 20 entries (or all if fewer).

requirements.text: Include a “Future AI Insights” page/section that is explicitly labeled as “coming soon” and describes (in English) what future AI features might do, without implementing any AI integration.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a visible section/page labeled “Future AI Insights (Coming Soon)”.
The section contains only static explanatory copy and no external AI/API integration.
Copy clearly states it is not providing medical advice or diagnosis.

requirements.text: Establish a coherent visual theme for VitaSense (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) appropriate for a health/wellness product, and apply it consistently across landing, auth, dashboard, and log flows (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).

quotes: I want create vitasense app for future ai health related

acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent theme across pages (buttons, cards, headings, spacing).
Primary color palette is not predominantly blue/purple.
UI looks intentionally branded (not default-styled) while remaining readable and accessible.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand assets for VitaSense (logo + simple hero illustration) and use them on the landing page and app header. Store them as static files and do not serve them from the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Logo and hero illustration exist as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing page displays the hero illustration and VitaSense logo.
App header/nav displays the logo in a compact form.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file).

Do not edit any frontend files under immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing any real AI/LLM features or calling external AI services.
Medical diagnosis, treatment recommendations, or claims of clinical accuracy.
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.

required: Minimal VitaSense wordmark logo with a subtle leaf/heartbeat motif (vitasense-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Soft wellness-themed abstract hero illustration with warm neutral tones and minimal shapes (vitasense-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
